cards.question: .backup ?DB? FILE
cards.answer: Backup DB (default "­mai­n") to FILE

cards.question: .bail ON|OFF
cards.answer: Stop after hitting an error. Default OFF

cards.question: .databases
cards.answer: List names and files of attached databases

cards.question: .dump ?TABLE? ...
cards.answer: Dump the database in an SQL text format.

cards.question: .echo ON|OFF
cards.answer: Turn command echo on or off

cards.question: .exit
cards.answer: Exit this program

cards.question: .explain ?ON|OFF?
cards.answer: Turn output mode suitable for EXPLAIN on or off.

cards.question: .header(s) ON|OFF
cards.answer: Turn display of headers on or off

cards.question: .help
cards.answer: Shows this inform­ation.

cards.question: .import FILE TABLE
cards.answer: Import data from FILE into TABLE

cards.question: .indices ?TABLE?
cards.answer: Show names of all indices

cards.question: .load FILE ?ENTRY?
cards.answer: Load an extension library

cards.question: .log FILE|off
cards.answer: Turn logging on or off. FILE can be stderr­/stdout

cards.question: .mode MODE ?TABLE?
cards.answer: Set output mode where MODE is one of: csv, column, html, insert, line, list, tabs, tcl

cards.question: .nullvalue STRING
cards.answer: Print STRING in place of NULL values

cards.question: .output FILENAME
cards.answer: Send output to FILENAME

cards.question: .output stdout
cards.answer: Send output to the screen

cards.question: .prompt MAIN CONTINUE
cards.answer: Replace the standard prompts

cards.question: .quit
cards.answer: Exit this program

cards.question: .read FILENAME
cards.answer: Execute SQL in FILENAME

cards.question: .restore ?DB? FILE
cards.answer: Restore content of DB (default "­mai­n") from FILE

cards.question: .schema ?TABLE?
cards.answer: Show the CREATE statements

cards.question: .separator STRING
cards.answer: Change separator used by output mode and .import

cards.question: .show
cards.answer: Show the current values for various settings

cards.question: .stats ON|OFF
cards.answer: Turn stats on or off

cards.question: .tables ?TABLE?
cards.answer: List names of tables

cards.question: .timeout MS
cards.answer: Try opening locked tables for MS millis­econds

cards.question: .width NUM1 NUM2 ...
cards.answer: Set column widths for "­col­umn­" mode

cards.question: .timer ON|OFF
cards.answer: Turn the CPU timer measur­ement on or off

cards.question: -init file
cards.answer: Read and execute commands from file , which can contain a mix of SQL statements and meta-c­omm­ands.

cards.question: -echo
cards.answer: Print commands before execution.

cards.question: -[no]h­eader
cards.answer: Turn headers on or off.

cards.question: -bail
cards.answer: Stop after hitting an error.

cards.question: -inter­active
cards.answer: Force intera­ctive I/O .

cards.question: -batch
cards.answer: Force batch I/O .

cards.question: -column
cards.answer: Query results will be displayed in a table like form, using whitespace characters to separate the columns and align the output.

cards.question: -csv
cards.answer: Set output mode to CSV (comma separated values).

cards.question: -html
cards.answer: Query results will be output as simple HTML tables.

cards.question: -line
cards.answer: Query results will be displayed with one value per line, rows separated by a blank line. Designed to be easily parsed by scripts or other programs

cards.question: -list
cards.answer: Query results will be displayed with the separator (|, by default) character between each field value. The default.

cards.question: -separator separator
cards.answer: Set output field separator. Default is "|".

cards.question: -stats
cards.answer: Print memory stats before each finalize.

cards.question: -nullvalue string
cards.answer: Set string used to represent NULL values. Default is (empty string).

cards.question: -version
cards.answer: Show SQLite version.

cards.question: -vfs name
cards.answer: Use name as the default VFS .

cards.question: -help
cards.answer: Show help on options and exit.
